Articles.Content:
Is there any limit on planets? When I'm installing all three expansion packs (Serious, Trans-Keptunian, Urania), Urania doesn't loads fully - I get only Urania itself and Rhea.

EDIT: Nevermind, just rummaged through Urania's cfg and saw that there is only two planets so far. Any ETA on full version?

Edited December 12, 2014 by biohazard15

Is there any limit on planets? When I'm installing all three expansion packs (Serious, Trans-Keptunian, Urania), Urania doesn't loads fully - I get only Urania itself and Rhea.

EDIT: Nevermind, just rummaged through Urania's cfg and saw that there is only two planets so far. Any ETA on full version?

Well, until I figure out to mess with non-heightmap PQS, I can't get many of the moonlets done.

Other than that, idk.
Ok, so what exactly did you do with this?

Ok, so what exactly did you do with this?

??????

I don't quite understand, sorry.
You took an existing mod, and you did....what with it?
He took the planets from the (deprecated) Planet Factory and recreated them in (less deprecated) Kopernicus +RSS.

He took the planets from the (deprecated) Planet Factory and recreated them in (less deprecated) Kopernicus +RSS.

Exactly what I was going to say.

Thank you.

Anyone else have issues with their video "flashing" after installing this? I have yet to dig deeply into what particular portion of this is causing my vid to freak out, so I'll experiment some tomorrow.

Oh, running Linux 64 on Ubuntu 14.04...

Anyone else have issues with their video "flashing" after installing this? I have yet to dig deeply into what particular portion of this is causing my vid to freak out, so I'll experiment some tomorrow.

Oh, running Linux 64 on Ubuntu 14.04...

I have no idea. A lot of mods break on Linux 64....

I have no idea. A lot of mods break on Linux 64....

I can't get this to install AT ALL. I'm pretty sure I put all the mods I needed in GameData, so what do I do?

I have no idea. A lot of mods break on Linux 64....

You might be confusing that with Windows x64: Linux 64 bit has traditionally been one of the most stable builds of KSP...

I can't get this to install AT ALL. I'm pretty sure I put all the mods I needed in GameData, so what do I do?

You're doing something wrong. Post a video perhaps?

You're doing something wrong. Post a video perhaps?

You think I have video recording software? I don't.

But I put all the folders inside the folder I downloaded into GameData, and it's not working.

Edited December 13, 2014 by lordmuffin
period.

You think I have video recording software? I don't.

But I put all the folders inside the folder I downloaded into GameData, and it's not working.

Did you install all the dependencies listed? If you installed this by itself then no, it will not work.

I'm going to venture that this mod with Windows x32 KSP = the only mod you're gonna run. I remember Krag's PF being a memory pig, so it certainly would be advantageous to have the option of having this work on Linux, since Windows X64 is, apparently, a smoldering mess (though I seem to have had no problem getting it to run, apart from most of the mods being intentionally nerfed).

Did you install all the dependencies listed? If you installed this by itself then no, it will not work.

I'm going to venture that this mod with Windows x32 KSP = the only mod you're gonna run. I remember Krag's PF being a memory pig, so it certainly would be advantageous to have the option of having this work on Linux, since Windows X64 is, apparently, a smoldering mess (though I seem to have had no problem getting it to run, apart from most of the mods being intentionally nerfed).

This uses around 5/7 of the memory the original PFCE did. I uninstalled all part packs, etc., the only mods I have are small plugins and BetterAtmospheres, DistantObject, PlanetShine, and TextureReplacer. I recommend trying OpenGL but for me it crashes before the load screen.

It can run with mods, but random crashes happen a lot.

Here's a pic of running it with TarsierSpaceTech and looking at Urania:

And another pic of an attempted landing on the coming-soon planet Librar, with it's moon Lakia just above the horizon:

Edited December 13, 2014 by _Augustus_

I'm going to venture that this mod with Windows x32 KSP = the only mod you're gonna run. This uses around 5/7 of the memory the original PFCE did. I uninstalled all part packs, etc., the only mods I have are small plugins and BetterAtmospheres, DistantObject, PlanetShine, and TextureReplacer. I recommend trying OpenGL but for me it crashes before the load screen.

Here's a pic of running it with TarsierSpaceTech and looking at Urania:

*snip*

I use Linux Kubuntu 64x, and I have a fair amount of mods, installed, and yes, the dependencies are there.
Just a request, could you make a KSP version of 10199 Chariklo? Rings included?
Are there science on these planets?

Are there science on these planets?

I tried to get science with CustomBiomes, but it currently doesn't work.

But, if you download the old Urania pack for PFCE you can copy the sciencedefs for those planets.

I'm working on science for everything.

Hmm, I don't know.

Oiapoque? After one of Chariklo's rings?

I tried to get science with CustomBiomes, but it currently doesn't work.

But, if you download the old Urania pack for PFCE you can copy the sciencedefs for those planets.

I'm working on science for everything.

If that doesn't work, you're not doing it right. I've gotten it to work with Poryy's Kerbal Universe. I'll make some for you if you want.

Edited December 14, 2014 by DuoDex

If that doesn't work, you're not doing it right. I've gotten it to work with Poryy's Kerbal Universe. I'll make some for you if you want.

Sure thing!

BTW, I'm naming the Chariklo analogue Raina. I just felt like it would fit....

(I actually stole it from that Kerbol's Asteroid Belt thread, because the guy gave up making a planet named Rainia. I changed it to Raina, as it, like Erin, can also be a name of a person...)

Edited December 14, 2014 by _Augustus_

Anyone else have issues with their video "flashing" after installing this? I have yet to dig deeply into what particular portion of this is causing my vid to freak out, so I'll experiment some tomorrow.

Oh, running Linux 64 on Ubuntu 14.04...

SOLVED. It stopped doing whatever it was doing when I installed Active Memory Reduction mod. Not sure why that fixed it, but I have a boatload of new planets floating around now, so yay that.

Okay, I really want to use some mods with my mod, but unfortunately it appears as if this is a memory-guzzler like the original. ATM either takes forever or doesn't work, and OpenGL crashes my game before the load screen.

Help anyone?

I can't get this to install AT ALL. I'm pretty sure I put all the mods I needed in GameData, so what do I do?

I'm getting your issue now... they just don't show up. It's something with the game....
